entry.title: The fly connectome reveals a path to the effectome (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
The fly connectome reveals a path to the effectome

Analysis of the whole-brain fly connectome reveals high-dimensional dynamics supported by many small independent circuits, motivating a proposal for optogenetic perturbation to efficiently learn a whole-brain causal neural dynamics model.

  • Dean A. Pospisil
  • Max J. Aragon
  • Jonathan W. Pillow
ArticleOpen Access02 Oct 2024

entry.title: Bulk high-temperature superconductivity in pressurized tetragonal La2PrNi2O7 (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Bulk high-temperature superconductivity in pressurized tetragonal La2PrNi2O7

Bulk high-temperature superconductivity observed in pressurized tetragonal La2PrNi2O7 was testified by detecting clear diamagnetic signals below about 75 K with appreciable superconducting shielding volume fractions at a pressure of above 15 GPa.

  • Ningning Wang
  • Gang Wang
  • Jinguang Cheng
Article02 Oct 2024

entry.title: Network statistics of the whole-brain connectome of Drosophila (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Network statistics of the whole-brain connectome of Drosophila

The network of the fly brain is highly recurrent and displays rich-club organization, with a large population (30%) of preferentially connected neurons.

  • Albert Lin
  • Runzhe Yang
  • Mala Murthy
ArticleOpen Access02 Oct 2024

entry.title: Neuronal wiring diagram of an adult brain (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Neuronal wiring diagram of an adult brain

FlyWire presents a neuronal wiring diagram of the whole fly brain with annotations for cell types, classes, nerves, hemilineages and predicted neurotransmitters, with data products and an open ecosystem to facilitate exploration and browsing.

  • Sven Dorkenwald
  • Arie Matsliah
  • Meet Zandawala
ArticleOpen Access02 Oct 2024

entry.title: Rapid homologue juxtaposition during meiotic chromosome pairing (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Rapid homologue juxtaposition during meiotic chromosome pairing

Homologue juxtaposition during meiosis is examined in real time by imaging of tagged chromosomal loci at high resolution in budding yeast, showing that corresponding loci come together and complete pairing in a very short time.

  • Tadasu Nozaki
  • Beth Weiner
  • Nancy Kleckner
Article02 Oct 2024

entry.title: Flickering gamma-ray flashes, the missing link between gamma glows and TGFs (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Flickering gamma-ray flashes, the missing link between gamma glows and TGFs

Flickering gamma-ray flashes associated with terrestrial thunderstorms have been observed, which may be the missing link between gamma-ray glows and TGFs.

  • N. Østgaard
  • A. Mezentsev
  • D. Mach
Article02 Oct 2024

entry.title: Differences in misinformation sharing can lead to politically asymmetric sanctions (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Differences in misinformation sharing can lead to politically asymmetric sanctions

We find that conservatives tend to share more low-quality news through social media than liberals, and so even if technology companies enact politically neutral anti-misinformation policies, political asymmetries in enforcement should be expected.

  • Mohsen Mosleh
  • Qi Yang
  • David G. Rand
AnalysisOpen Access02 Oct 2024

entry.title: A Drosophila computational brain model reveals sensorimotor processing (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
A Drosophila computational brain model reveals sensorimotor processing

We create a computational model of the adult Drosophila brain that accurately describes circuit responses upon activation of different gustatory and mechanosensory subtypes and generates experimentally testable hypotheses to describe complete sensorimotor transformations.

  • Philip K. Shiu
  • Gabriella R. Sterne
  • Kristin Scott
ArticleOpen Access02 Oct 2024

entry.title: Signature of the western boundary currents in local climate variability (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Signature of the western boundary currents in local climate variability

Analyses based on high-spatial-resolution data demonstrate that sea surface temperature variability in the western boundary currents has a more robust signature in local climate variability than previously indicated.

  • James G. Larson
  • David W. J. Thompson
  • James W. Hurrell
Article02 Oct 2024

entry.title: Mortality caused by tropical cyclones in the United States (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Mortality caused by tropical cyclones in the United States

A large-scale evaluation of the long-term effects of tropical cyclones on human mortality in the contiguous United States estimates that the average tropical cyclone results in 7,000–11,000 excess deaths, far exceeding previous estimates.

  • Rachel Young
  • Solomon Hsiang
ArticleOpen Access02 Oct 2024

entry.title: Whole-brain annotation and multi-connectome cell typing of Drosophila (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Whole-brain annotation and multi-connectome cell typing of Drosophila

A consensus cell type atlas for the fly brain provides both an intellectual framework and open-source toolchains for brain-scale comparative connectomics.

  • Philipp Schlegel
  • Yijie Yin
  • Gregory S. X. E. Jefferis
ArticleOpen Access02 Oct 2024

entry.title: RNA m5C oxidation by TET2 regulates chromatin state and leukaemogenesis (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
RNA m5C oxidation by TET2 regulates chromatin state and leukaemogenesis

Chromatin-associated retrotransposon RNA 5-methylcytosine can be recognized by the methyl-CpG-binding-domain protein MBD6, which guides deubiquitination of nearby monoubiquitinated Lys119 of histone H2A to promote an open chromatin state in TET2-deficient cells.

  • Zhongyu Zou
  • Xiaoyang Dou
  • Chuan He
ArticleOpen Access02 Oct 2024

entry.title: Tuft cells act as regenerative stem cells in the human intestine (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Tuft cells act as regenerative stem cells in the human intestine

Four distinct tuft cell states are identified by combining analysis of primary human intestinal resection material and organoids, and studying tuft cell development shows that they represent a damage-induced reserve intestinal stem cell pool in humans.

  • Lulu Huang
  • Jochem H. Bernink
  • Hans Clevers
ArticleOpen Access02 Oct 2024

entry.title: Highly dynamic gamma-ray emissions are common in tropical thunderclouds (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Highly dynamic gamma-ray emissions are common in tropical thunderclouds

Tropical thunderclouds over ocean and coastal regions are shown to emit gamma rays for several hours over areas of up to a few thousand square kilometres, contradicting the quasi-stationary picture of glows.

  • M. Marisaldi
  • N. Østgaard
  • A. Santos
Article02 Oct 2024

entry.title: Neuronal parts list and wiring diagram for a visual system (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Neuronal parts list and wiring diagram for a visual system

An analysis of the Drosophila connectome yields all cell types intrinsic to the optic lobe, and their rules of connectivity.

  • Arie Matsliah
  • Szi-chieh Yu
  • Gregory S. X. E. Jefferis
ArticleOpen Access02 Oct 2024

entry.title: Connectomic reconstruction predicts visual features used for navigation (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Connectomic reconstruction predicts visual features used for navigation

Electron-microscopy data are used to reconstruct the neurons that make up the anterior visual pathway in the Drosophila brain, providing insight into how visual features are encoded to guide navigation.

  • Dustin Garner
  • Emil Kind
  • Sung Soo Kim
ArticleOpen Access02 Oct 2024

entry.title: LYCHOS is a human hybrid of a plant-like PIN transporter and a GPCR (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
LYCHOS is a human hybrid of a plant-like PIN transporter and a GPCR

Cryo-electron microscopy structures of the human lysosomal transmembrane protein LYCHOS show that it comprises a transporter-like domain fused to a G-protein-coupled receptor, and that the transporter domain is similar to the plant PIN family.

  • Charles Bayly-Jones
  • Christopher J. Lupton
  • Andrew M. Ellisdon
ArticleOpen Access02 Oct 2024

entry.title: Calcium-permeable AMPA receptors govern PV neuron feature selectivity (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Calcium-permeable AMPA receptors govern PV neuron feature selectivity

Calcium-permeable AMPA receptors are identified to have a role in maintaining low feature selectivity in a specific population of inhibitory interneurons, and this function is conserved across ferrets, rodents, marmosets and humans.

  • Ingie Hong
  • Juhyun Kim
  • Richard L. Huganir
ArticleOpen Access02 Oct 2024

entry.title: Predicting visual function by interpreting a neuronal wiring diagram (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Predicting visual function by interpreting a neuronal wiring diagram

A study demonstrates the interpretation of a neuronal wiring diagram of the optic lobe of Drosophila, yielding theoretical predictions about visual functions of this structure.

  • H. Sebastian Seung
AnalysisOpen Access02 Oct 2024

entry.title: Neural circuit mechanisms underlying context-specific halting in Drosophila (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Neural circuit mechanisms underlying context-specific halting in Drosophila

Two halting mechanisms, ‘walk-OFF’ and ‘brake’, are shown to be engaged by distinct neural circuits in Drosophila, in a context dependent manner.

  • Neha Sapkal
  • Nino Mancini
  • Salil S. Bidaye
ArticleOpen Access02 Oct 2024

entry.title: Plotting Fluorescent Spectra (Brady Johnston)
entry.content:
Plotting Fluorescent Spectra
ggplot2
R
coding
fluoresence
How do we go about plotting some spectral data from fluorophores, to get something like below?
Brady Johnston
Sep 3, 2022

entry.title: Interactively Visualising Proteins (Brady Johnston)
entry.content:
Interactively Visualising Proteins
bioinformatics
R
protein
Recently I’ve been doing a lot of structural bioinformatics. To avoid having to export my results into PyMol of Chimerax, I wanted a better solution that could embed the results more easily into the report that I was writing.
